White Bean Eggplant Caponata (1 Pan!)
item.description: Have you tried caponata? If not, let us introduce you! It’s a delicious Sicilian eggplant dish with sweet and savory flavor, and we ADORE it! While commonly served as an appetizer or side, it’s worthy of being a main when a little protein and fiber are added in. Introducing: white bean eggplant caponata! Made in 1 pan with just 10 ingredients , this is an effortless, plant-based entrée that pairs well with pasta, polenta, bread, or even mashed potatoes. item.title: A US Trustee wants troubled fintech Synapse to be liquidated via Chapter 7 bankruptcy, cites ‘gross mismanagement’
item.description: The prospects for troubled banking-as-a-service startup Synapse have gone from bad to worse this week after a United States Trustee filed an emergency motion on Wednesday. The trustee is asking to convert the company’s debt reorganization Chapter 11 bankruptcy into a liquidation Chapter 7, according to court documents. item.title: Good News in History, May 17
item.description: 124 years ago today, L. Frank Baum’s first children’s novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz was published in the US. The first edition was printed and bound by Baum himself for presentation to his sister, Mary Louise Baum Brewster. The first 10,000 copies sold out fast, and by 1938 over a million were sold. Telling the story […] The post Good News in History, May 17 appeared first on Good News Network .

item.title: Majestic Sei Whales Reappear in Argentine Waters After Nearly A Century
item.description: GNN has reported several times over the last three years about large baleen whales returning to waters in which they haven’t been sighted for decades. item.title: 13-year-old Successfully Undergoes World-First Treatment to Cure Rarer-Than-Rare Wild Syndrome

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg’s makeover: Midlife crisis or carefully crafted rebrand?

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: Good News in History, May 16
item.description: 306 years ago today, Maria Agnesei was born in Milan. She is the first woman in the Western World ever to be appointed as a professor of mathematics at a university. She is credited with writing the first book discussing both differential and integral calculus. Her name is remembered most often today through her mathematical […] The post Good News in History, May 16 appeared first on Good News Network .
